description: [Status: stable] [Name: django-locals-in-render-function] [Message: Avoid passing locals() as context to a render function] What it does Checks for the use of locals() in render functions. Why is this bad? Using locals() can expose internal variables or other unintentional data to the rendered template. Example from django.shortcuts import render def index(request): posts = Post.objects.all() return render(request, "app/index.html", locals()) Use instead: from django.shortcuts import render def index(request): posts = Post.objects.all() context = {"posts": posts} return render(request, "app/index.html", context)
